lines.text: [Ethel and Elsie are playing Scrabble. Ethel has just put down the letters "-ucker", to which Elsie has added "muther-"]
Wait, Elsie. I think you're wrong. I think you spell that word with a hyphen.

[repeated several times during the car chase]
Far out!
[giving Gloria a rape alarm, a can of MACE and a knuckleduster]
Take these. Without them, you are a walking light-bulb... waiting to be screwed.
Beware of the dwarf.
Gee Scotty, I don't think there is a dwarf in this movie.
What do you say to a bottle of wine and a couple of steaks?
Well, you could start by saying, "Hello".
I think we got off on the wrong foot.
Yes, and it seems to be in your mouth.
OK, I deserve that. Listen, it's Gloria, right? You're a really nice girl and I'm a nice guy, and you're very pretty with or without cleavage, and what do you say... would you like to take a shower?
I don't pick up strange men.
Well, that's your problem.
So why don't you try it?
Want a joint? You know what they say, cops have the best dope.

[to Gloria]
That's right, honey. You've attacked an innocent dwarf.
Gloria, just sit back and enjoy the fire. I'm pouring you a nice, warm, albino martini. Here you go, drink this, then it's off to bed.
You should have been a doctor.
Okay, we'll play whatever you like.
He told me all about Monica.
Monica?
Yes, Monica.
[reads from note clipped to Tony's refrigerator]
"Darling, you are all out of milk and cottage cheese. I will pick them up in the morning. Love, Monica."
Oh, Monica. She's my cleaning lady. She comes in twice a week and really cleans the decks.
Uh-huh. Trims the sails?
Blows the pipes.
Will we be expecting her today at all?
No, we won't be seeing her any more. You see, Monica drowned this morning.
Oh, really? Just like that.
Yeah. It was really sad but we both saw it coming.
I play Detective. You play Lady In Distress.
Hey, wait a minute. It's *my* ass they're after.
I'm sorry. You're right. That was a stupid, glib, chauvinist remark and I apologize. It *is* your ass they're after, and it's my job to see to it that... I get there first.

[trying to explain the car chase]
Kojak - Bang bang?
Ah, Kojak - Bang bang!
[breaks into laughter]
Do you have any binoculars?
What's that? Binoculars. Are you into that, too? Me, as well. I read about it in Penthouse. Just a second.
Here it is, my own little beaver trap.
Take me home.
What?
Take me home, please.
Uh, sure. Um... my place or-or, yours?
Which is closer?
Like that man told you in the movies last night, beware of the midgets. They're taking over the world.
[after whipping Delia Darrow in a fight and stuffing her into a piano]

[panting]
She was one tough old mama!
Whitey Jackson? Is he the football player that wears the pantyhose on TV?

We were attacked, laughed at, and finally imprisoned. But it was there, in those hellholes, where the mind is bound and the spirit is shackled, that we realized that the single most effective way to bring about radical change is the historically proven path of violence.
Nobody's gonna mess with Stella unless Stella wants to be messed.

Oh, ho, I'll tell ya, I've been on some dumb calls in my time, but this one tops 'em all. Where did you meet this ding dong anyway? Hey, what's all that stuff about having her for lunch down at the station house tomorrow? You're not even supposed to be riding around with me.
It's fate, Fergie. It's kismet.
Kismet, my ass. Listen, this girl is weird, Tony...
Yeah, yeah, yeah, but she's got the prettiest green eyes I've ever seen.
Hey, they're blue. And behind those blue eyes is a fruitcake with a homicidal umbrella.

[excitedly]
Wait a minute.
What?

[grabbing Fergie's face and looking into his eyes]
You're the one with the prettiest green eyes I've ever seen.
You cut that out. I hate it when you do that. Don't do that anymore, all right?
Let's go, beautiful.
Suppose that guy attacked you instead of pulling that weird stunt in the theater, huh? What would you have done?
I would have hit him with my umbrella.
Talk about ancient! Really, honey, you've got to drag yourself into the Seventies! You've got to get some merchandise!
Gloria, sweetheart, we live in a violent society. Weirdos all around. Get them before they get you.
Sylvia. Where ya going, honey?
Look, I'm sorry, Harry. Intermission's in twenty minutes. And I gotta go warm up the ah, wienies.
Well, what was he after?
He wanted the cigarettes.
He was after a cigarette?
Oh no, he wanted the whole pack.
Man, talk about greedy.

[Delia returns to the study and slams the door behind her, looking livid]
Well fellas, now the shit has really hit the fan!
Whitey, Stiltskin, and Turk]
